revised_title: The Role of Artificial Rhythm in the Locomotor System of Medusae
tldr: This article explores the role of artificial rhythm in the locomotor system of Medusae, showing that natural rhythm is not solely due to the intermittent nature of ganglionic charge. Instead, it is influenced by an alternate process of exhaustion and restoration of excitability in responding tissues. The research also highlights the importance of lithocysts, which are rudimentary vision organs, and the polypite's ability to perform localized movements.
